entities: International Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia (ICTY)
summary:
The Security Council, 
Taking note of the Secretary-General's letter and the International Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia's ("the Tribunal") letters, 
Recalling its previous resolutions, particularly 1503 (2003) and 1534 (2004), which call on the Tribunal to complete investigations, trials, and all work by 2004, 2008, and 2010 respectively, 
Determined to support the Tribunal's completion of trial work, 
 Acting under Chapter VII of the UN Charter, 
1. Extends the terms of office of permanent judges in the Appeals Chamber: 
- Liu Daqun (China) 
- Theodor Meron (United States) 
- Fausto Pocar (Italy) 
- Mohamed Shahabuddeen (Guyana) 
until 31 December 2010 or completion of cases; 
2. Extends the terms of office of permanent judges in the Trial Chambers: 
- Carmel Agius (Malta) 
- Jean-Claude Antonetti (France) 
- Iain Bonomy (United Kingdom) 
- Christoph Flügge (Germany) 
- O-Gon Kwon (South Korea) 
- Bakone Justice Moloto (South Africa) 
- Alphons Orie (The Netherlands) 
- Kevin Parker (Australia) 
- Patrick Robinson (Jamaica) 
- Christine Van den Wyngaert (Belgium) 
until 31 December 2009 or completion of cases; 
3. Extends the terms of office of ad litem judges currently serving: 
- Ali Nawaz Chowhan (Pakistan) 
- Pedro David (Argentina) 
- Elizabeth Gwaunza (Zimbabwe) 
- Frederik Harhoff (Denmark) 
- Tsvetana Kamenova (Bulgaria) 
- Uldis Kinis (Latvia) 
- Flavia Lattanzi (Italy) 
- Antoine Kesia-Mbe Mindua (Democratic Republic of Congo) 
- Janet Nosworthy (Jamaica) 
- Michèle Picard (France) 
- Árpád Prandler (Hungary) 
- Kimberly Prost (Canada) 
- Ole Bjørn Støle (Norway) 
- Stefan Trechsel (Switzerland) 
until 31 December 2009 or completion of cases; 
4. Extends the terms of office of ad litem judges not currently serving: 
- Melville Baird (Trinidad and Tobago) 
- Frans Bauduin (The Netherlands) 
- Burton Hall (The Bahamas) 
until 31 December 2009 or completion of cases.
The Security Council

1837 (2008)

 Adopts the following:

5. Decides, without prejudice to the provisions of resolution 1800 (2008) of 20 February 2008, to amend article 12, paragraphs 1 and 2, of the Statute of the Tribunal and to replace those paragraphs with the provisions set out in the annex to this resolution.

6. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
